where the metal wire of the brush head meets the handle of the brush.
This clearly indicates that the head of the Provox Brush XL has been
bent, which is prohibited as stated in the IFU. The brush head of the
Provox Brush consists of Nylon filaments as bristles, twisted metal wire
(Name: SUS304, diameter: 0.65mm, stainless steel) and a PP-plastic
tip on top of the brush head. This stainless steel wire has its breaking
point at 758 N/mm/42 on average, making it very resilient to mechanical
forces. It takes repeated damage to the material (such as bending it
back and forth repeatedly) to weaken and subsequently break the
material. Furthermore, SUS303 is a medical grade steel used in a
variety of medical products (such as implants and surgical tools). As a
consequence, this kind of steel has to pass vigorous quality controls.
The maximum forces applied to the brush during a cleaning procedure
are at 13.7N. The chances of dislocating the voice prosthesis while
cleaning are high when applying more than 13.7N of force.
Therefore, the customer would have dislocated his VP before applying
enough force to damage the brush.
e4869e3c018d655e094913c6396f8728:
Brush head broke off and patient believed that the brush head was
lodged in the tracheal wall. Patient went to the Emergency department
for extraction. This is the third recurrence on this user. Previous report
indicates brush head was bent at the wire instead of at the stem as
described in the IFU.
Provox Brush XL is a device for cleaning Provox voice prostheses
in-situ. The brush is intended for single patient reuse and is intended for
both home and clinical use by patient or clinician. Maximal use 1 month.
Cleaning of voice prosthesis is performed by moving the brush gently
back and forth with a twisting movement in the inner lumen of the voice
prosthesis.
ccb2a63480f21a8be38bed8c42f554e3:
The damage to the product is most likely caused by wrong handling of
the product. No corrective action is to be taken.
